Text: If Health Care passes...Can we finally say that the President has succeeded...END

Sure . . . . he will have succeeded in instituting a major step towards a single payer health system and thus expanding the state's control over people's lives, creating multigenerational debt and creating untold misery through the joys of rationed healthcare.

Have doubts it is a step towards socialized healthcare?  Just ask Barney Frank, who has publicly said he wants a single payer system and that the public option is the best way to work towards it.  Something tells me he knows more about the Democrats goals than you, tricky.

Once tax dollars fund the majority of healthcare, the nanny statists will feel justified in interfering with peoples lives and the current health nazis and their crusade against transfats, salt and sugary drinks will look like nothing.

I keep hearing about the destruction of the American Health Care system, the Government will control every aspect of my life, and the debt will spiral out of control...For one the bill on the table is not for single payer...Two we spent Billions on Weapons of Mass Destructions which did not exist...So I could care less about the billions you are personally paying for...Third this is not about worrying about whether or not the GREEDY Insurance companies are happy....Its about fixing a BROKEN system...END

Thanks jwhitt.  Tricky, we should be more worried about the present administration's mockery of the Constitution in trying to get their agenda passed. As Obama has said, "I don't care about the process, as long as health care passes."
Clearly Tricky didn't read my comment.
@trickeldick it depends on what you consider success to be...

A clunker that travels 12,000 miles a year at 15 mpg uses 800 gallons of gas a year.
A vehicle that travels 12,000 miles a year at 25 mpg uses 480 gallons a year.
So, the average Cash for Clunkers transaction will reduce US gasoline consumption by 320 gallons per year.
The Obama administration claims 700,000 vehicles so that's 224 million gallons saved per year.
That equates to a bit over 5 million barrels of oil.
5 million barrels is about 5 hours worth of US consumption.
More importantly, 5 million barrels of oil at $70 per barrel costs about $350 million dollars.
So, the government paid $3 billion of our tax dollars to save $350 million.
We spent $8.57 for every dollar we saved.
I'm pretty sure they will do a great job with our health care, though.

Has anyone informed trickdaddy that ending each comment with "...END" makes him seem sort of  like a program from TRON?
End of Line.
He brings new meaning to the term "obamabot".
